julia.code: """ pearson_correlation(x, y) Find the pearson correlation between two variables. # Example: julia> PearsonCorrelation([12,11,16,17,19,21],[11,51,66,72,12,15]) -0.2092706263573845 Contribution by: [Aru Bhardwaj](https://github.com/arubhardwaj) """ function pearson_correlation(x, y) mean_x = sum(x) / length(x) mean_y = sum(y) / length(y) XY = (x .- mean_x) .* (y .- mean_y) XXs = sum((x .- mean_x) .* (x .- mean_x)) YYs = sum((y .- mean_y) .* (y .- mean_y)) return(sum(XY) / (sqrt(XXs .* YYs))) end
